  • Changelog

    Check sample quality and filter the count matrix

    run_qc_and_filtering.Rd

    This function is used to reads the output from cellranger, create a seurat object, apply basic filtering, and normalise and cluster the filtered counts.

    run_qc_and_filtering(
  exp_meta,
  sample_num,
  pipeline,
  minFeatures,
  pcDims = 30,
  mtPerc = 20,
  source = "raw",
  source_type = "dir",
  organism = "human",
  isVerbose = FALSE,
  vst_flavor = NULL,
  input_matrix = NULL,
  isFixed = FALSE,
  remove_doublets = FALSE,
  mtPattern = NULL,
  riboPattern = NULL,
  seurat5 = FALSE,
  bpcells_dir = NULL,
  labeling_celline = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    exp_meta

    Metadata table (data.frame by default)

    sample_num

    Row number of the metadata file containing the sample information

    pipeline

    Perform SCT or lognorm normalisation

    minFeatures

    Maximum number of genes to filter out

    pcDims

    Number of PCs (30 by default)

    source

    Use the data from the raw or filtered cellranger matrix (raw by default)

    source_type

    dir by default

    organism

    Set the sample organism (human by default)

    isVerbose

    Print all the messages on screen (FALSE by default)

    vst_flavor

    sctransform version

    Value

    Returns

    a folder, named as the sample ID, containing QC figures and tables

    a seurat object with filtering and clustering applied

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
run_qc_and_filtering(exp_meta,number,".","SCT", 500, 30, source = "raw", source_type = "outs", isVerbose=FALSE)
}
